summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York reporting a call from a high-profile woman who claimed to have been sexually assaulted by a man she believed was associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutor requests the FBI reach out to the potential victim.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, reporting a call from a potential victim and requesting FBI follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual the alleged perpetrator was associated with.

connections.description: The prosecutor is handling a case or inquiry related to individuals associated with Epstein.

events.title: Potential Victim Call to Prosecutor
events.description: A high-profile woman called an Assistant U.S. Attorney, claiming she was previously sexually assaulted by a man she believed was associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A high-profile woman contacted a federal prosecutor in July 2020, alleging she was sexually assaulted by a man associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The potential victim provided only a first name and a phone number, but caller ID provided additional identifying information.
The prosecutor, based on the caller's description, accent, and caller ID, believed they could identify the woman.
The prosecutor requested the FBI reach out to the potential victim for further investigation.
The document indicates ongoing investigative interest in Epstein-associated sexual assault allegations years after his death.
